text: British Sounds (also known as See You at Mao) is an hour-long film shot in February 1969 for television, written and directed by Jean-Luc Godard and Jean-Henri Roger, and produced by Irving Teitelbaum and Kenith Trodd. London Weekend Television refused to screen it owing to its controversial content, but it was subsequently shown with success in cinemas. Godard credited the film as being made by 'Comrades of the Dziga-Vertov group'. ==References== == External links == * British Sounds at Vimeo * * * Category:1969 television films Category:1969 films Category:Films directed by Jean-Luc Godard Category:Films directed by Jean-Henri Roger Category:British avant-garde and experimental films Category:British films Category:British television films
title: British Sounds
